quote: What then is that which is able to conduct a man? One thing and only one, philosophy.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Brave men rejoice in adversity, just as brave soldiers triumph in war.
author: Seneca

quote: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
author: Cicero

quote: If I followed the multitude, I should not have studied philosophy.
author: Chrysippus

quote: Six mistakes mankind keeps making century after century: Believing that personal gain is made by crushing others; Worrying about things that cannot be changed or corrected; Insisting that a thing is impossible because we cannot accomplish it; Refusing to set aside trivial preferences; Neglecting development and refinement of the mind; Attempting to compel others to believe and live as we do.
author: Cicero

quote: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
author: Plutarch

quote: Philosophy is an act of living.
author: Plutarch

quote: Nothing is more active than thought, for it travels over the universe, and nothing is stronger than necessity for all must submit to it.
author: Thales

quote: If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need.
author: Cicero

quote: Time is the wisest of all things that are; for it brings everything to light.
author: Thales

quote: Appearances are a glimpse of the unseen.
author: Anaxagoras

quote: He who hesitates is lost.
author: Cato

quote: The Fates guide the person who accepts them and hinder the person who resists them.
author: Cleanthes

quote: Men would live exceedingly quiet if these two words, mine and thine, were taken away.
author: Anaxagoras

quote: A single day among the learned lasts longer than the longest life of the ignorant.
author: Posidonius

quote: As a matter of self-perseveration, a man needs good friends or ardent enemies, for the former instruct him and the latter take him to task.
author: Diogenes

quote: Each man’s soul is his genius.
author: Xenocrates

quote: Freedom is not procured by a full enjoyment of what is desired, but by controlling the desire.
author: Epictetus

quote: To be ignorant of what occurred before you were born is to remain always a child.
author: Cicero

quote: Those whom true love has held, it will go on holding.
author: Seneca

quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all others.
author: Cicero

quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle.
author: Plato

quote: All cruelty springs from weakness.
author: Seneca

quote: If someone succeeds in provoking you, realize that your mind is complicit in the provocation.
author: Epictetus

quote: Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Love is born into every human being; it calls back the halves of our original nature together; it tries to make one out of two and heal the wound of human nature.
author: Plato, The Symposium

quote: No man is more unhappy than he who never faces adversity. For he is not permitted to prove himself.
author: Seneca

quote: Speak the truth as you see it. But with kindness. With humility.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Have I done something for the common good? Then I share in the benefits.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: In marriage, there must be complete companionship and concern for each other on the part of both husband and wife, in health and in sickness and at all times, because they entered upon the marriage for this reason as well as to produce offspring. When such caring for one another is perfect, and the married couple provides it for one another, and each strives to outdo the other, then this is marriage as it ought to be and deserving of emulation, since it is a noble union. But when one partner looks to his own interests alone and neglects the other’s, or (by Zeus) the other is so minded that he lives in the same house, but keeps his mind on what is outside it, and does not wish to pull together with his partner or to cooperate, then inevitably the union is destroyed, and although they live together their common interests fare badly, and either they finally get divorced from one another or they continue on in an existence that is worse than loneliness.
author: Rufus

quote: What progress, you ask, have I made? I have begun to be a friend to myself.
author: Hecato Of Rhodes

quote: In your actions, don’t procrastinate. In your conversations, don’t confuse. In your thoughts, don’t wander. In your soul, don’t be passive or aggressive. In your life, don’t be all about business.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: I begin to speak only when I’m certain what I’ll say isn’t better left unsaid.
author: Cato

quote: We have two ears and one mouth, so we should listen more than we say.
author: Zeno, Quoted By Diogenes Laërtius

quote: Man’s character is his fate.
author: Heraclitus, Fragments

quote: You will earn the respect of all if you begin by earning the respect of yourself. Don’t expect to encourage good deeds in people conscious of your own misdeeds.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: People often say what is right and do what is wrong; but nobody can be in the wrong if he is doing what is right.
author: Xenophon, Conversations Of Socrates

quote: Never discourage anyone…who continually makes progress, no matter how slow.
author: Plato

quote: Most people, when they are set upon looking into other people’s affairs, never turn to examine themselves.
author: Xenophon, Conversations Of Socrates

quote: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
author: Aristotle

quote: I will reveal to you a love potion, without medicine, without herbs, without any witch’s magic; if you want to be loved, then love.
author: Hecato Of Rhodes

quote: Virtue is the health of the soul.
author: Aristo Of Chio

quote: Kindness is unconquerable, so long as it is without flattery or hypocrisy. For what can the most insolent man do to you, if you contrive to be kind to him, and if you have the chance gently advise and calmly show him what is right…and point this out tactfully and from a universal perspective.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: 'Mind over matter' is a powerful expression. Your ability to consciously control your mindset is what makes you mentally tough and ready for life’s challenges. The secret to achieving this resilient state lies in taking control of your thoughts and allowing your thoughts to control your behaviors, not the other way around. Your ability to take control of your emotional responses and live a stoic-inspired life is the secret to success, to your happiness, and to your improved well-being. When you are able to see situations as opportunities and emotional responses as conscious choices—when you realize things don’t happen to you but rather with you—your outlook completely changes. How you see your situation affects and influences how you feel about that situation. You are not merely a byproduct of your circumstances. You are a choosing being who has the ability to determine your emotional responses, which in turn shapes how you view the world, yourselves, and others. But learning to change your perspectives takes practice—practice which will in turn help increase your self-confidence. By practicing cognitive restructuring, you can retrain your brain and create new habits that will make you the master of any situation. When choosing how you feel and react becomes your choice, you will feel more in control. “Don’t hope that events will turn out the way you want, welcome events in whichever way they happen: this is the path to peace.
author: Epictetus

quote: Nothing beautiful without struggle.
author: Plato, The Republic

quote: Recognize that if something is humanly possible, you can do it too.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The worst type of man behaves as badly in his waking life as some men do in their dreams.
author: Plato, The Republic

quote: Ask yourself at every moment, is this necessary?
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: You have to assemble your life yourself, action by action.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Rule your mind or it will rule you.
author: Horace

quote: Love is a serious mental disease.
author: Plato, Phaedrus

quote: The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it. Skillful pilots gain their reputations from storms and tempests.
author: Epictetus

quote: Don’t be overheard complaining…not even to yourself.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Everything hangs on one’s thinking…a man is as unhappy as he has convinced himself he is.
author: Seneca

quote: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more in imagination than in reality.
author: Seneca

quote: External things are not the problem. It’s your assessment of them, which you can erase right now.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
author: Seneca

quote: Today, I escaped from anxiety. Or, no; I discarded it, because it was within me, in my own perceptions—not outside.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.
author: Seneca

quote: Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems.
author: Epictetus

quote: No man can have a peaceful life who thinks too much about lengthening it.
author: Seneca

quote: People are frugal in guarding their personal property; but as soon as it comes to squandering time they are most wasteful of the one thing in which it is right to be stingy.
author: Seneca

quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
author: Epictetus

quote: Don’t explain your philosophy. Embody it.
author: Epictetus

quote: Nothing, to my way of thinking, is a better proof of a well ordered mind than a man’s ability to stop just where he is and pass some time in his own company.
author: Seneca

quote: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power or our will.
author: Epictetus

quote: Every hour, focus your mind attentively… on the performance of the task in hand, with dignity, human sympathy, benevolence and freedom, and leave aside all other thoughts. You will achieve this, if you perform each action as if it were your last.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Excess in anything becomes a fault.
author: Seneca

quote: It is essential that we not respond impulsively… take a moment before reacting, and you will find it easier to maintain control.
author: Epictetus

quote: Deaths that are greater, greater portions gain.
author: Heraclitus

quote: The awake share a common world, but the asleep turn aside into private worlds.
author: Heraclitus

quote: If it’s endurable, then endure it, stop complaining.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: If it is not right, do not do it, if it is not true, do not say it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: How does it help…to make troubles heavier by bemoaning them?
author: Seneca

quote: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Don’t allow yourself to be heard any longer griping about public life, not even with your own ears!
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: We must take a higher view of all things, and bear with them more easily: it better becomes a man to scoff at life than to lament over it.
author: Seneca

quote: Death is not the worst that can happen to men.
author: Plato

quote: People are like dirt. They can either nourish you and help you grow as a person or they can stunt your growth and make you wilt and die.
author: Plato

quote: The first rule is to keep an untroubled spirit. The second is to look things in the face and know them for what they are.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Men seek out retreats for themselves in the country, by the seaside, on the mountains… nowhere can a man find a retreat more peaceful or more free from trouble than his own soul.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Order your soul. Reduce your wants.
author: Augustine Of Hippo

quote: Men are of little worth. Their brief lives last a single day. They cannot hold elusive pleasure fast; Ii melts away. All laurels wither; all illusions fade; Hopes have been phantoms, shade on air-built shade since time began.
author: Sophocles

quote: To bear trials with a calm mind robs misfortune of its strength and burden.
author: Seneca

quote: Misfortune nobly born is good fortune.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this, you have the power to revoke at any moment.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The willing are led by fate, the reluctant dragged.
author: Cleanthes

quote: All that exists is the seed of what will emerge from it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Well-being is attained little by little, and nevertheless is no little thing itself.
author: Zeno Of Citium

quote: All the gold which is under or upon the earth is not enough to give in exchange for virtue.
author: Plato

quote: Ask yourself at every moment, is this necessary?
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Rashness belongs to youth; prudence to old age.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Cowards die many times before their death.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: Think of yourself as dead. You have lived your life. Now take what’s left and live it properly.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: For a man to conquer himself is the first and noblest of all victories.
author: Plato

quote: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not.
author: Epicurus

quote: The only thing I know is that I know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: There is no easy way from the earth to the stars.
author: Seneca

quote: The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it.
author: Epicurus

quote: The greatest obstacle to living is expectancy, which hangs upon tomorrow, and loses today.
author: Seneca

quote: To move the world, we must first move ourselves.
author: Socrates

quote: Only the dead have seen the end of war.
author: Plato

quote: Mortal as I am, I know that I am born for a day. But when I follow at my pleasure the serried multitude of the stars in their circular course, my feet no longer touch the earth.
author: Ptolemy

quote: Since every man dies, it is better to die with distinction than to live long.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Let us prepare our minds as if we’d come to the very end of life. Let us postpone nothing.
author: Seneca

quote: Imagine that the keeper of a huge, strong beast notices what makes it angry, what it desires, how it has to be approached and handled, the circumstances and the conditions under which it becomes particularly fierce or calm, what provokes its typical cries, and what tones of voice make it gentle or wild. Once he’s spent enough time in the creature’s company to acquire all this information, he calls it knowledge, forms it into a systematic branch of expertise, and starts to teach it, despite total ignorance, in fact, about which of the creature’s attitudes and desires is commendable or deplorable, good, or bad, moral or immoral. His usage of all these terms simply conforms to the great beast’s attitudes, and he describes things as good or bad according to its likes and dislikes, and can’t justify his usage of the terms any further, but describes as right and good the things which are merely indispensable, since he hasn’t realized and can’t explain to anyone else how vast a gulf there is between necessity and goodness.
author: Plato, The Republic

quote: He who fears death will never do anything worth of a man who is alive.
author: Seneca

quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
author: Plato

quote: Death smiles at us all, but all a man can do is smile back.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Well begun is half done.
author: Aristotle

quote: Your days are numbered. Use them to throw open the windows of your soul to the sun. If you do not, the sun will soon set, and you with it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
author: Plato

quote: There could be no justice, unless there were also injustice; no courage, unless there were cowardice; no truth, unless there were falsehood.
author: Chrysippus

quote: If you want rainbow, you have to deal with the rain.
author: Augustus

quote: The tranquility that comes when you stop caring what they say. Or think or do. Only what you do.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Not what we have but what we enjoy constitutes our abundance.
author: Epicurus

quote: Nothing exists except atoms and free space, everything else is opinion.
author: Democritus

quote: Before a crowd, the ignorant are more persuasive than the educated.
author: Aristotle

quote: The truth is like a lion; you don’t have to defend it. Let it loose; it will defend itself.
author: Augustine Of Hippo

quote: If God listened to the prayers of men, all men would quickly have perished: for they are forever praying for evil against one another.
author: Epicurus

quote: Wisdom outweighs any wealth.
author: Sophocles

quote: In anger we should refrain both from speech and action.
author: Pythagoras

quote: First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.
author: Epictetus

quote: I do not know whether I shall make progress; but I should prefer to lack success rather than to lack faith.
author: Seneca

quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realise this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: If a friend feels upset by you, be the first to try to put things right.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity.
author: Hippocrates

quote: Dogs and philosophers do the greatest good and get the fewest rewards.
author: Diogenes

quote: Above all things, respect yourself.
author: Pythagoras

quote: The mind that is anxious about future events is miserable.
author: Seneca

quote: To study philosophy is nothing but to prepare oneself to die.
author: Cicero

quote: A bad feeling is a commotion of the mind repugnant to reason and against nature.
author: Zeno

quote: Better to do a little well than a great deal badly.
author: Socrates

quote: He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it’s not the same river and he’s not the same man.
author: Heraclitus

quote: How does it help…to make troubles heavier by bemoaning them?
author: Seneca

quote: What we do now echoes in eternity.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The soul is dyed the color of its thoughts. Think only on those things that are in line with your principles and can bear the light of day. The content of your character is your choice. Day by day, what you do is who you become. Your integrity is your destiny—it is the light that guides your way.
author: Heraclitus

quote: If you accomplish something good with hard work, the labor passes quickly, but the good endures; if you do something shameful in pursuit of pleasure, the pleasure passes quickly, but the shame endures.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Reject your sense of injury and the injury itself disappears.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Pleasures, when they go beyond a certain limit, are but punishments.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Wealth is able to buy the pleasures of eating, drinking and other sensual pursuits—yet can never afford a cheerful spirit or freedom from sorrow.
author: Musonius Rufus, Musonius Rufus On How To Live

quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
author: Seneca

quote: Rather fail with honor than succeed by fraud.
author: Sophocles

quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The problem creates the solution. What stands in the way becomes the way.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Bitter are the roots of study, but how sweet their fruit.
author: Cato

quote: The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.
author: Diogenes

quote: Be indifferent to what makes no difference.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: It is greed to do all the talking but to not want to listen at all.
author: Democritus

quote: As fire tests gold, so misfortunate tests brave men.
author: Seneca

quote: A fool is known by his speech; and a wise man by silence.
author: Pythagoras

quote: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.
author: Euripides

quote: Look back over the past, with its changing empires that rose and fell, and you can foresee the future, too.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Think your way through difficulties: harsh conditions can be softened, restricted ones can be widened, and heavy ones can weigh less on those who know how to bear them.
author: Seneca

quote: Nothing is needed by fools, for they do not understand how to use anything, but are in want of everything.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Here is a rule to remember in future, when anything tempts you to feel bitter: not, ‘This is misfortune,’ but, ‘To bear this worthily is good fortune.’
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: When a dog is tied to a cart, if it wants to follow, it is pulled and follows, making its spontaneous act coincide with necessity. But if the dog does not follow, it will be compelled in any case. So it is with men, too: even if they don’t want to, they will be compelled to follow what is destined.
author: Zeno

quote: Glory follows virtue as if it were its shadow.
author: Cicero

quote: He needs little who desires but little.
author: Cleanthes

quote: The fates lead the willing but drag the unwilling.
author: Cleanthes

quote: The first step: Don’t be anxious. Nature controls it all.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The goal of life is living in agreement with Nature.
author: Zeno

quote: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
author: Plato

quote: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
author: Seneca

quote: Except our own thoughts, there is nothing absolutely in our power.
author: Descartes

quote: Wise people are in want of nothing, and yet need many things.
author: Chrysippus

quote: The fool’s life is empty of gratitude and full of fears; its course lies wholly toward the future.
author: Epicurus

quote: Before you heal someone, ask him if he’s willing to give up the things that make him sick.
author: Hippocrates

quote: Nothing truly stops you. Nothing truly holds you back. For your own will is always within your control.
author: Epictetus

quote: Contentment is natural wealth, luxury is artificial poverty.
author: Socrates

quote: Seek not the good in external things; seek it in yourselves.
author: Epictetus

quote: Concern should drive us into action and not into depression. No man is free who cannot control himself.
author: Pythagoras

quote: No man is hurt by himself.
author: Diogenes

quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

quote: Confine yourself to the present.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: One man is worth thousand if he is extraordinary.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Why should we pay so much attention to what the majority thinks?
author: Socrates

quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
author: Zeno Of Citium

quote: Nature does nothing uselessly.
author: Aristotle

quote: As long as you live, keep learning how to live.
author: Seneca

quote: Devote the rest of your life to making progress.
author: Epictetus

quote: People who labor all their lives but have no purpose to direct every thought and impulse toward are wasting their time-even when hard at work.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The essence of philosophy is that a man should so live that his happiness shall depend as little as possible on external things.
author: Epictetus

quote: And you can also commit injustice by doing nothing.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
author: Seneca

quote: You become what you give your attention to.
author: Epictetus

quote: At dawn, when you have trouble getting out of bed, tell yourself: I have to go to work—as a human being. What do I have to complain of, if I’m going to do what I was born for—the things I was brought into the world to do? Or is this what I was created for? To huddle under the blankets and stay warm?
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Wait for that wisest of all counselors: time.
author: Pericles

quote: The best livelihood (particularly for the strong) is earning a living from the soil, whether you own your land or not. Many can support their families by farming land owned by the state or private landowners. Some even get rich through hard work with their own hands. The earth repays those who cultivate her, both justly and well, multiplying what she received—endowing in abundance all the necessities of life to anyone willing to work— and all this without violating your dignity or self-respect!
author: Musonius Rufus, Musonius Rufus On How To Live

quote: Just that you do the right thing. The rest doesn’t matter.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The heaviest penalty for declining to rule is to be ruled by someone inferior to yourself.
author: Plato, The Republic

quote: Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.
author: Plato

quote: The measure of a man is what he does with power.
author: Plato

quote: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.
author: Plato

quote: There is truth in wine and children.
author: Plato, Phaedrus

quote: If you don’t have consistent goal in life, you can’t live it in a consistent way.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: You are well aware that it is not numbers or strength that bring the victories in war. No, it is when one side goes against the enemy with the gods’ gift of a stronger morale that their adversaries, as a rule, cannot withstand them. I have noticed this point too, my friends, that in soldiering the people whose one aim is to keep alive usually find a wretched and dishonorable death, while the people who, realizing that death is the common lot of all men, make it their endeavour to die with honour, somehow seem more often to reach old age and to have a happier life when they are alive. These are facts which you too should realize (our situation demands it) and should show that you yourselves are brave men and should call on the rest to do likewise.
author: Xenophon, The Persian Expedition

quote: Let your speech be better than silence, or be silent.
author: Dionysius

quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
author: Seneca

quote: Having the fewest wants, I am nearest to the gods.
author: Socrates

quote: It is thus with farming: if you do one thing late, you will be late in all your work.
author: Cato The Elder

quote: Enjoy present pleasures in such a way as not to injure future ones.
author: Seneca

quote: The first and greatest victory is to conquer yourself.
author: Hierocles

quote: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
author: Aristotle

quote: A gift consists not in what is done or given, but in the intention of the giver or doer.
author: Seneca

quote: He who conquers his passions is master of his own worlds.
author: Hierocles

quote: He who has equipped himself for the whole of life does not need to be advised concerning each separate thing, because he is now trained to meet his problem as a whole; for he knows not merely how he should live with his wife or his son, but how he should live aright.
author: Aristo Of Chios

quote: The highest good is not to seek to do good but to allow yourself to become it.
author: Hierocles

quote: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow-ripening fruit.
author: Aristotle

quote: As it is with a play, so it is with life - what matters is not how long the acting lasts, but how good it is.
author: Seneca

quote: So it is with men too: even if they don’t want to, they will be compelled to follow what is destined.
author: Zeno

quote: Mastery of reading and writing requires a master. Still more so life.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Anyone who can make you angry becomes your master.
author: Epictetus

quote: Accept whatever comes to you woven in the pattern of your destiny, for what could more aptly fit your needs?
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Attach yourself to what is spiritually superior, regardless of what other people think or do. Hold to your true aspirations no matter what is going on around you.
author: Epictetus

quote: A humble art affords us daily bread.
author: Nero

quote: Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms you’ll be able to use them better when you’re older.
author: Seneca

quote: To be even-minded is the greatest virtue.
author: Heraclitus

quote: From this instant on, vow to stop disappointing yourself, separate yourself from the mob. Decide to be extraordinary and do what you need to do—now.
author: Epictetus

quote: He who sweats more in training bleeds less in war.
author: Greek Proverb

quote: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
author: Epictetus

quote: He has the most who is content with the least.
author: Diogenes
